meanings.definition: A selection from the books of the Prophets read in synagogue following the Torah reading on Sabbaths and festivals.
meanings.sent1: During the service, the rabbi read the haftarah aloud to the congregation.
meanings.sent2: The haftarah is an important part of the Sabbath tradition in many Jewish communities.
meanings.sent3: When the haftarah was accidentally skipped, the congregation shared a knowing smile.
meanings.sent4: The haftarah echoed through the synagogue, filling the air with ancient wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the haftarah lingered in the hearts of the listeners long after the service ended.
